intro: Hieracium excisum, commonly known as the cutleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with serrated or lobed leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are deeply lobed or dissected. Its flowers are yellow, forming dense clusters at the ends of the stems, and it is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Hieracium excisum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
